W_DWdWoLzgqrje9qQdLjBA.text: By far the best fish and chips I've ever had...and I'm not a fan of fish and chips. Not overly oily, nice and flaky, crispy and just plane delicious. I swapped the chips for salad and it was perfect. I could had have so much more fish!

O60wLlxRkLg8UyTeRA2nFA.text: This is one of the restaurants I love to come to come to London to stop and eat at. It is very small so you must either come early or make reservations. I had the shepherds pie, which I absolutely love. It is made with lamb and has a lovely gravy to pour over it. The meal is huge. It also comes with greens. I could only eat half. My husband ordered fish cakes which came with poached eggs on top and hollandaise sauce on the side. He finished his plate. We finished our meal with a sticky toffee pudding sundae with caramel sauce, the epitome of decadence. I left completely satisfied.  The service was excellent. I absolutely would recommend this place to anyone. I know I'll be coming back again on my next trip to London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding sundae
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Fish cake
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Shepherds pie

HUAxxCEcA1-dCIJZLA6MTQ.text: I have to admit we came onto this place after the restaurant we were looking for was closed. But it was a nice surprise.The place is decorated in a modern but cozy way, sort of an upgrade of a chippy.The service is very attentive, we were seated right away and our coats taken care of. We all ordered the Mayfair classic which consisted of a fillet of cod or halibut, chips, mushy peas, curry sauce or gravy and tartare sauce. Unfortunately, there was a confusion with our order and it took ages for them to sort it out.The fish and chips were not greasy at all and the fish was very crispy and flavourful, on the other hand the chips were quite bland and had to douse them in salt and vinegar to enjoy them, the peas were fine as well as the sauces.All in all this is a nice  alternative for satisfying your chippy  craving.

ATQgvwdEetiZRFFKDLI0Jg.text: The food was okay. I was disappointed to see the fish so soggy and it was sitting in its own oil. If the restaurant had drained some of the oil off before plating it, I think the fish would have stayed crispy. I've had better fish and chips in other restaurants, this place seems to be more of a tourist trap

y4jMx4WK_CtN25RjP1lJgA.text: This was a terrible experience. The wait staff were also rude and never served us. They wouldn't allow us to sit a table only the bar stools but allowed others to sit at the same table we asked for. Then they served us the wrong food and it took so long to get our correct order,  they were serving people who just walked in before our food came so we walked out . It was fish and chips for Peet's sake, nothing gourmet. They were rude and unapologetic!  Be forewarned

s2OCNS3ReGGqCbVJUHcoxw.text: We ordered Cod & Chips.  The fish was mushy, had no sign of typical flakiness of cod - was it really cod???- and the bottom was very soggy.  The chips were freshly cooked and tasty, but the portion was very small.  The service was slow as there were only two servers.  So it did not justify the prices they charge.

NPNA6iO1H4N83kmjY7wAaA.text: We were staying by Hyde Park and needed something for a late night dinner. This fit the bill for being simple and close by. Turned out to be quite delicious! Their fish and chips were very nicely battered and were not soggy by the time they were served. I personally really enjoyed their mashed peas- super yum with a little kick at the end. Will be back next time we're in London.

3GuZ9jweV9ZYHUkYnIaUBA.text: Fantastic beet root salad - among the best I have ever had.  Chips are top notch and the variety of sauces for the fish were great.  Book marked this one!

xvK-IblKsfcE7cXhF7AvmQ.text: This is literally the best fish and chips you will have in your life. Hands down. I have traveled England and this place is just amazing. The Scotch egg is also one of the best I have ever had. I know it sounds crazy but even the chips are great. The place is small and I suggest that you use open table to get a reservation. They also have a really good selection of gins. I don't know why they don't expand this place they would make a killing. Me and my coworkers actually went 3 times while in London for 5 days.

iURwt7-wii77ftvmU4QN_w.text: Food was good. Portions were a fair reflection of the price. The fish was nice n chunky, tastes better after you soaked under a lot of malt vinegar. The place was far too crowded for it to be an enjoyable experience. If this is your first time in London, make sure you call for a reservation.. otherwise you'll end up with the crack of your backside welcoming all the passing guests, as you enjoy your delicious dinner. I don't need to mention how uncomfortable eating on a stool can be for some.

Zo78qn9f4GOaBQsOLUohFA.text: This is a cute and charming place. The salt and pepper squid is delicious and fresh. The chips aka French fries are amazing and taste like home.

mDZv5QDqNre1x3VrNq5HZA.text: The fish and chips?  Straight legit .... this place absolutely lives up to all the hype. The service is also about what you expect for a place that is going to pop you for 17% just for sitting down and enduring British waiters. The place does a very brisk take out service. And with good reason.  The food is well done, well portioned and the price is about what you might expect so close to Bond street. What you may not expect is the small dining rooms. As an example - we were seated by a couple of young men who set next to us and talked endlessly about their winter holiday sleeping with pros in Eastern Europe and then laughing very, very loudly. Now.... usually - this kind of thing would only make me laugh as well, but we were in a dining room the size of my wife's walk in closet in America. So - the noise and the details were a bit much. I doubt the place can sit more than 35 people (make a reservation). So we had to hear these two bloviating jack wagons the entire meal. Meh... even so - like I said, the food was great. I'd like to go five stars here but I just can't because of the noisy conditi. In a perfect world we would take our meal back to the hotel and enjoy it there.  With cheaper beer. Possibly in our pajamas.

XC_hAi7DMugn5IMFphqFnw.text: We were in London only for a day and we were looking for some Fish & Chips. We stumbled upon this amazing restaurant while walking one street off  Oxford street.This restaurant is amazing! Great food, the interior is really cute and the service was very fast.I highly recommend Mayfair Chippy ( formerly known as The Great Britain) to anyone whose visiting London and is looking for a nice restaurant to sit down and enjoy some Fish and Chips.Oh, and the beers they have on tap are really good too!

kgVjBEmz9npoyEJiHfIPjw.text: Not a special chip and expensive. They charge you 12.5% servicing fee. Even they added one more beer I did not order on my receipt. I was a tourist and emailed them to refund me for the extra beer but they have not answered at all. They try to be kind and apparently they do not treat you with full gratitude.    12.5%    ,    .      .        .

V00XIMDrDgk3VINFNrj78g.text: Such a cute place! Review for the takeaway service only. We were looking for some fish and chips on our last day in London so I searched in the area and this place came up 50m away so we made a quick detour. So glad we did! A takeaway menu will set you back 10,50£ and include haddock or cod with chips plus mushy peas, curry sauce and tartare sauce. Chunky home cut chips, (better than your average chippy!) and a huge piece of fish in a perfect batter. Perhaps the only thing they could improve is draining the fish on paper after frying as it was a little oily towards the end. Side note; a slice of lemon would be nice and also PLEASE change the cutlery. Wooden cutlery is my pet peeve as as much as the aesthetic is nice, it is HORRIBLE to eat with. The service was nice and rapid, 5-10 minutes wait and piping hot and fresh. The interior is adorable also so definitely a good lunch option to eat in. A great little place!

9JGqITBUsxj5dBx1liDhSw.text: We were looking for fish and chips in London and looked at some on line reviews to help make a decision.  It is humorous to think about making reservations at a chippy. Still, as we were ahead of the evening rush, we were seated quickly and served promptly.  It was good, it was hot, the wait staff were friendly. My fish and chips craving is satisfied for the next few years. Wouldn't walk the almost two miles to eat fish and chips there again though.

9q-0EAGKVVsvXySmXQxOog.text: I absolutely love this place. Close proximity to where I stay in London. Beautiful neighborhood. Affordable and most importantly the fish and chips are awesome!  This is a great place to get away from the standardized pub menus (which is strange to me). Every time I have been I get the cod. I love it! The service is great, staff is very friendly, and accommodating. I have also noticed their service is fast. Which is huge if you are on a business trip in the area pressed for time.

xqSZbeYeX-7M2c4Vl4kYsw.text: Best fish and chips I've had in my (short) time in London!A short way away from Oxford street, it's a cute little restaurant with tiled walls and tables.  Usually we don't like fish and chips that are too fishy in taste but this was perfect.  Came with a few sauces which we loved.  The chips are nothing special but overall immensely enjoyed the meal!

wwQhtZmJBpLDeaMQA8tMYw.text: Incredible food, service and location. The shepherd's pie is out-of-this-world. I wanted the recipe as I live in Canada, emailed, and Pete Taylor was kind enough to forward it in and follow up. These guys know food, the hospitality business and customer service. They do all three exceptionally well and are always customer-centric. You have to try this place if you want traditional British fayre with a contemporary twist. Highly recommend.

ZSPAWwPsKFg64BsQghvM6Q.text: Expertly fried fish, good size and excellent. I really liked the chips and appreciated the choices of sauces they have. Strongly recommended reservations for some excellent Fish and Chips in London.

8FUeFMRTpP_LnXY1bWmCaA.text: We had Fish and Chips and Shepherd's Pie. I expexted to hate the food. But we loved it. Actually the we loved every restaurant we have been in Londond and tha t was thatk's to checking the ratings before going in. Service is ok.

XR3tC2tzqbmgbVpyF3eq0Q.text: Soooo good! We came for the fish and chips and we found them! Clean, reasonably priced and very tasty!

hPcpXVrRh2OVh7jrTrr45w.text: Delicious fish and chips!! Ordered the halibut since I've never had a halibut fish and chips and honestly it didn't taste much different from cod. But that's fine! It was great; crispy on the outside but still moist inside. Of the three dipping sauces, (tartar, curry, and mushy peas) my favorite was the curry sauce. This sauce goes great with the fries too.  I also had the beetroot salad which was so refreshing. The vegetables were very fresh and the goat cheese was delicious. It was quite filling. They do take reservations which is nice because I heard they can get pretty busy.

laSH5rstHLnwp4nVv4GVMg.text: Meh.The fish and chips are really greasy and kinda mushy; not crispy as I had expected and do expect with fish and chips. Service is super slow and the room in the back gets very loud. I won't be going back but I'm glad I tried this place out. The cocktails are good and the bathrooms are clean, though.

IBok62VvKygmoUD324sZdQ.text: Went on a fish & chips odyssey in London. I'm from the north so I know good fish & chips when I taste them. I lived in London a long time and I can definitely say that The Mayfair Chippy has the best fish & chips I have had in the South. I can only give 4 stars because there are way better fish & chips up north... I would absolutely go back here next time I\m in London.

Ov6LSzrtEChFBGf2Orn9YA.text: Fish & Chips in London...you kind of have to, right? So we looked around at our options and found this place based on Yelp reviews. It looked great and had some awards to back it up. We came in on a rainy evening and we're seated right away. We both ordered the fish & chips but differed on the fish selection: I ordered the haddock and my buddy ordered the cod. The service was great. We were attended to at appropriate times and had enough space to enjoy our meal without feeling rushed. The fish & chips were out of this world. It had an elegant crunch without being over battered and the fish was the star. The mushy peas were nice as well-great organic pea flavor. The homemade tartar sauce was bomb, but I didn't care much for the sweetish curry dipping sauce. The fries were thick cut and had a wonderful crunch as well. The malt vinegar tableside added that extra touch. If you're looking for reasonably priced fish & chips in London that has quality you can taste then drop by here! It was the only fish & chips that we had and we were satisfied.

X4sHq9qLId4XQ4hSIoxJLw.text: Fish and chips are the best we had in our stay in England. It was a busy Saturday night and they accommodated our party of 5 without reservations. Good service and a must eat if you are in the area!

lPftKMNNkhEwf4lE80gcBA.text: My husband and I were pretty hungry after a long walk from Paddington Station to do some Oxford St shopping and saw a street kiosk advertising the Mayfair Chippy. Just a quick jot off of Oxford and we found ourselves seated in a quaint, adorable little shop.It was, by far, the best fish and chips I'd ever had. I opted for the cod while my husband went for the haddock, so that we could compare and make notes. And it was absolutely DELICIOUS. Light and fluffy, with definitive flavors that separated each large piece as haddock and/or cod, every bite was tender and juicy and crispy. So many places, I feel, no matter the fish you order, all taste the same but no, not here! Here it was amazingly fresh and delectable, topped with great fries and an awesome, caper filled tarter sauce.Make it a stop if you happen to be near. So worth the buzz.

swrI0STQqHfsj91_zrrfrw.text: Amazing!!!! Best finish and chips I've ever had. And the tartar sauce is delicious. Must check out this spot!!! In a great area as well.

eKgScoKWD8qCdJdiDl2Zlg.text: I liked this place but was it a stellar experience? No. The staff was very nice. We were seated promptly for our reservation although our table wasn't ready so we were told we had to be out in an hour. That wasn't a problem as we had to go to the theatre but it was odd that our reservation seemed less important than the 7pm one. The table seats are very wobbling and can be uncomfortable or dangerous for elderly. Again, they fixed this issue too. However the most disappointing part was that we all wanted dessert but were never informed that the dessert prep is homemade and takes 15 mins to make. Knowing we were in a rush it would have been so nice to know that ahead of time rather than dropping it on us at the end. Ice cream was the only dessert option but then she told us ice cream was unavailable. So. Yeah. Not a five star experience and food was good but not good enough to warrant a return visit.

FzZ4EzwD9Bll2KfdHgkq2Q.text: This gave us a bad greasy feeling afterwards! I really wanted to like this place as I went here based on reviews.

kwaTNUV63oa0cB69WiGNxQ.text: Great fish & chips. Service was excellent. Unfortunately they were out of salmon when we went, that's why 4 instead of 5 Stars. We didn't have a reservation but they got us in quickly and then offered us a better table once one opened up.

j2hyyLzdabFiz3Y8bOs9GQ.text: We had a nice Sunday lunch in this quiet location in Mayfair.Fish and chips crunchy and savory served with a creamy sauce. The price is right for the portion, even bigger than we expected.Staff friendly and quite fast service.Definitely coming back to try something else!

r08eWLeYRQDFkFPeHwdZ_A.text: Best fish and chips I've had in London. Beer on tap as well. Love the Mayfair neighborhood. Excellent service, food presentation and clean/contemporary interior design. A perfect lunch spot.

g9h_Ht1Knk0Zl2mXw71O4Q.text: Quiet cozy place just off a main artery. Food was great and the beer was cold.  Not much to say about this place. I would probably come for lunch as this is a light fare but good none the less.

oXzdSf1Ei06bbaLCYBejKg.text: Cute atmosphere in the main restaurant, although I sat in the back room, which was a little bland and quiet. Good food at a reasonable price. Solid meal if you're looking for fish and chips during your visit. I did think the fish to be a bit bland, but the menu had a lot of other options that looked pretty good.

W-2JUTHdTkeBt1PI_yf3CA.text: Loved the classic fish&chips but they were really slow, it tooks them forever to bring it to us

9PHuJKE5ZCGVWd8BeVoBZg.text: Overrated and over-priced.  Good piece of haddock ruined by the pool of oil it was wallowing in.  Staff inattentive. And why should I have to pay £2 for a glass of water?  Could be so much better.

uUVhkpOMTd5Ig8ppmrdPhA.text: Sorry not sorry, but this rating is entirely based upon service. We walked into this cute little place expecting to enjoy a British beer and some classic British food, but ended up entirely ignored. We sat for almost 30 full minutes before being totally fed up with no one coming to the table (table tent explicitly stated to pick a seat and they'd come to us). One waitress, who may have been off the clock, was standing at the bar drinking coffee and talking on her phone. Another waitress passed my table more than 5 times, cleaned the table next to mine, but never approached our table. I tried to flag down the busboy but he looked downright frightened and still no service. I appreciate that European service is more relaxed than American, but after 35 minutes we had had enough and left. Truly disappointing given prior reviews.

kUZU0Y3bOwBXuNRnR3Xavg.text: Best Shepards pie and fish and chips I've found in London to-date!  Took my father and I multiple days to find a place we actually fell in love with, but now we have. May come back tomorrow as well!

5fEMMoFv3yGSginU_ZDjjw.text: Fitted us in without a reservation. Probably to be expected that the fish and chips were excellent. But the service and wine and desert were also great. Worthy of five stars in a an area with high standards!

qhZyVIR3cPqTzZ-dzF8fpg.text: They have great British food, but I got a cod loin (or some other sort of white fish) and it was miniscule. Really. I paid the most of anyone at my table but was still starving afterward. My friend visiting from Paris had the fish and chips and another had shepherd's pie, both of which were quite filing (they said) and hearty. Neither finished theirs, which was great, because I could have eaten three more of my own dish. Needing handouts aside, they have a great house red and make incredibly tasty food. The service is good, the ambience is nice - but darn it, make more generous portions of fish, please.

n_6YaOkZZBPDVbkNXBzXHw.text: Very nice fish and chips, found it via Yelp. Love the place, quiet, private and nicely designed.

7DsbCAjyOPO5IsSktwEr2Q.text: Excellent fish and chips. Vibrant take out  trade in addition. Kind of hard to find especially due to adjacent construction. and smaller that one would expect. Close to U.S. Embassy. If you don't want the mashed peas, request the garden peas. Staff is most pleasant.

u_4gM343cw1f7h7rFmu0_Q.text: Wonderful meal! Traditional British fare prepared beautifully our party had Sausages and Mash, as well as the Lamb Rump. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food. The service was prompt and a little abrupt in presentation. The music was played loudly, however, given we were the only guests there at the time, the staff obliged in turning it down right when asked. I would return to this restaurant to enjoy more English dishes.

wILxEU86YqC5EgWsF0NnlQ.text: Try to go earlier in the evening for the "Early Bird Special." Two courses for £15. Bleu Cheese and pear salad was great and the Shepard's pie was very good also. Good service, good beer selection, good food.

m6RwIE3uvKfO5axsRoaxBw.text: Fabulous! The fish is light and crispy outside and juicy and tender inside. Best non-fancy-restaurant fish and chips we've had in London. Great location as well.

muw9Ryh0VuwLb8ESR7qHSw.text: Great service...The fish and chips were delicious..I see why they are finalists of the 2016 national fish & chip awards and best newcomer award!

_p_D32zGMZ9nVGrSZcC2YA.text: We stumbled onto this wonderful gem during a business trip.  I'm not a huge fan of Shepard's Pie - but this place completely changed my perspective on the dish...  The dish was phenomenal tasting and the service was great too..  My colleague had lots of great things to say about her fish & chips too...  Small place, but great food and great service - highly recommended...

zSeX4phZGdKMn_mtxme1Ig.text: I haven't been to London in over 15 years and I don't remember having fish and chips the first time I came. The Mrs. was able to look up this fantastic spot, The Mayfair Chippy, for some Michelin rated or award (not sure what type of Michelin but they have the stickers for it) which wasn't too far from our hotel during our stay in London. We stopped by around 7pm and it wasn't too busy on a weekday. Ordered one order of the fish and chips and waited about 5-10 minutes and the fish was massive. Tasted even better...never had such a light, fluffy, crispy fish and chips even from the US before. If you're in the area and looking for a great place for fish and chips...The Mayfair Chippy is the place to go. Their staff is also very helpful and very kind. Was able to use their wifi without any issues. Wasn't able to try anything else on their menu because this was an after dinner snack, but their fish and chips definitely does not disappoint.

XLml588Hap3Dp4T5plweIg.text: Very average for FnCs. I couldn't believe how expensive it was for 2 orders a side of peas and a pint. I think our bill was 54 GBPs. That is over the top. Service was so, so. And there isn't a whole lot of room to sit. On a Monday night we were asked if we had reservations. I would pass on this unless you have money to spare.

ZHdQ_wqWB-iKTedWSk4Amw.text: When a fellow Yelper comes to town, we set out to try and knock off a couple of things from our bookmarks and this happened to be on her bookmark list.  I wasn't sure if there was seating as I hadn't read any of the reviews, but since it was close to where we were, we thought we'd have a look.  It looks quite small from the front, however, there is more seating through the little passage.  They asked if we had a reservation, but we didn't, so they sat us at a large, shared table... it is cute, but the little stools that swing out are a bit wobbly.  A pint of cider doesn't help ;).  They put us at the end so there was room for the pram (stroller for my fellow Americans)  We overheard the couple at the other end of the table asking if there were other seats and the waiter told them that the other tables were reserved.  So note that if you are coming as a small group (there were 8 seats at this shared table) or want to make sure you get a seat inside, then you should probably make a reservation.  We lucked out. I can always count on Cara to want to try multiple things and doesn't mind sharing...  my kind of foodie!  We decided to have an order of each of the fritters:  homemade black pudding with apple sauce, smoked haddock Kedgeree with coronation mayo, and salt beef with creamed horseradish.  Then we decided to order the Mayfair Classic with cod to split.  I think our desire to have the fritters came out of the desire to have hushpuppies with our fish and chips.  I know it is an American thing, but a girl can dream!  We rated the fritters in the following order:  Kedgeree (although I thought the coronation mayo was overpowering), salt beef with creamed horseradish, and we weren't fans of the black pudding at all (the apple sauce was nice though).The Mayfair Classic has to be the poshest (and most expensive) fish and chips I have ever had.  The fish was delicious and the batter was light and lovely.  It was a bit on the greasy side though.  The chips.... well I could have easily just had the fish with no chips as they were a bit mushy.  I am not a huge curry sauce and chips fan and I'm afraid their curry sauce won't convert me... it was a bit bland.  So really in the end, if I were to order again, I'd probably just order the fish.  With two ciders we ended up spending just under £50, so not exactly for someone on a tight budget.  If you are looking for a cheap and cheerful chippy this is not it, but if you are looking for a nice selection of seafood and wanting to splurge a bit, this is a definite Yelp bookmark!

w3OPGwJKnbaD1qbHxsJhsg.text: Brilliant!  We sought out 2-3 fish and chips places to hit over our recent week in London. While this place is upscale compared to the standard great shop (eg the Golden Chippy in Greenwich), this place was the best. Had the cod, the haddock, a few other things too. A really nice and unexpected thing was the variety of gin and tonics to sample. If you like your T&Ts, you'll enjoy their gin menu.

9TJVvl8QKVm85YFU26wncQ.text: Wow! Sooo good.We came from Chicago looking for some good & original fish and chips and we found it.Location is awesome and food is phenomenal! My fiancé and I both had a beetroot salad& cod fish and chips. Honestly, I would probably skip the salad and try a dessert next time. The fish was AMAZING & so were the fries. Would definitely come back next time we are in London.

Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

TfZanGTyikqoRSUV2EUgzA.text: Quite nice, small shop that was willing to accommodate 4 of us without a reservation. Sympathetic to some wandering Americans. I've had fish and chips before but never sure what is properly done. The food was great for a newly like myself- went with haddock over Cod. Being from the US I'm used to shoestring fries vs steak fries cuts- Will say it was beyond piping hot when it came out.

H3ch8D_kNgqyJz-KluLd9w.text: We went here last night, and it definitely did not disappoint. My wife and I each got The Mayfair Classic, which is a piece of fried fish, chips (fries), and 3 dipping sauces (tartar, curry, and mushy peas). I guess the peas aren't really a dipping sauce, but all three came in the same cute measuring cup style containers.We are visiting from San Francisco, and I consider myself to be somewhat of a fish and chips snob... I've loved the dish since I was a little boy, and in San Francisco, we have plenty of excellent seafood restaurants that do a mean fish & chips. They Mayfair Chippy was just as good!I was impressed by how nicely the fish was fried. We had both haddock and cod; I slightly preferred the haddock, but you can't go wrong with either one. We also got the homemade pickles, which were a nice addition to the meal. Toddlers can be a good indicator of how good food is; If our two year old doesn't like something a lot, he won't pretend. Unlike his lunch earlier today where he claimed, "All done... no more... trash... (etc)," he couldn't get enough of this fish & chips! The little man must have eaten almost half of both my wife's and my fish!I recommend the Mayfair Chippy. Get a reservation, though... We had one for last night, and we came an hour early to see if we could be seated sooner. The restaurant told us that we would have to wait and that it would be impossible to sit sooner. It's a hot spot! ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Great fish + chips = happy family :-)
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Our little man loved it!
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Fish w/ 3 sauces

7ktQYuUy3r1JFCfp4YZ6zw.text: This review not about the food. Tourist so excited to come here after an exhausting day. We were thrilled they were open till 10pm walked really far to get there. Walked in at 9:30 wouldn't seat us. Really disappointed when the closing time on the website was 10pm. Woman at the front said they actually close we 9:45. Very frustrating they should change their website to say 9:30 closing to avoid people like us coming far to be turned away.

6E81Gwz09ckQkVOu-k1lXg.text: Best fish and chips I have ever had in London. Its hard to find a great chippy.Crispy, hot, well prepared and served in newsprint and basket, with three different sauces: Tartar, Mushy Peas and Curry. So from the traditional and old fashioned, to the northern clubbing habit of curry with fish and chips. They also have a nice local craft lager to wash it down with. We loved our lunch. Truly a chippy in Mayfair.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair "Classic" Haddock. Best fish n chips I've ever had in London.
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair Chippy. Best fish n chips I've ever had in London.

H7tfPCpMiEaa5Cmpr0yd7w.text: Cute place known for its Fish n Chips - fresh and delicious cod - served with smashed peas, tartar sauce and a third sauce. The Halloumi starter was quite average with pretty much no flavor whatsoever.

j7I_8h4RzVSpO5zZMRmR3g.text: The best fish and chips I have had so far!  I had the heritage tomato salad (loved the salad dressing), cod fish and chips and mussels.  Everything tasted fresh and filled with flavor.  My favorite Super cute place and decent service. No need for a reservation.

tV6_9uzP4VWUrFb0tjjXYg.text: They get very busy! If possible make a reservation ahead of time. Food was excellent. Good variety to choose from. Yummy Fish & Chips!

Evek4ua4WPlj7uaAbpqrEg.text: I like fish and chips a lot, a family friend owned a fish and chip place, so there are nostalgic memories associated with eating this type of meal.When in London...go here at least once. I wish I could've gone again.Fantastic cod fish and chips. Repeat. Fantastic! Generous portions, crispy chips, extremely busy, but the Michelin rating and yelp reviews are well earned. We ordered takeout, and after receiving the order, whilst outside, we broke off a bit of fish and ate it sans dip. Crispy batter, melt in your mouth fish. A good sign.A little while later, we sat down to finish the meal and try the dips. Holy crap, what an excellent tartar sauce, the best I've ever had.  Tasty curry dip. I tried the mashed peas but kept going back for the tartar.

y10asC-YJDnS0wtI1VaAmg.text: My new favorite place for fish & chips.  We were welcomed by the friendly staff.  I order the classic cod.  Great texture with great taste, perfect!

swTG_8qV9yNPDVVLKb__eA.text: Lovely fish and chips with tasty beer. Very cozy atmosphere and nice staff. Definitely recommended.

oN7y5dZzUP1ja3EhfJ4hWQ.text: If you want a good fish an chip place, this qualifies, but they're a little bit wonky on the their service, and when you have to wait almost 40 minutes to get fish n' Chips, it should be way better than your average place.  Also, they turned people away who didn't have a reservation, but when another party came in without reservations, one of the guys asked the hostess, she kind of looked around and said ok we can do it.  Places that do that, sorry it just bugs me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

qY-Sh6TIG6MEgfT6qEqssw.text: The food here is absolutely delicious. We ended up here by just wandering around the area and through yelp reviews. And so glad we did! We had the fish and chips (cod), and the shepherd's pie. Perfectly delicious. The dessert was the best - raspberry crumble. Highly recommend this place.

1McZXvABugdpZO_DlboZLQ.text: Some of the better fish and chips I've had in London. This cute little upscale shop is worth a visit. I had the classic fish and chips with sides. All of it was excellent (mushy peas were so-so). I would go back for sure. Lots of great shopping and stores in this area as well.

7hlE0cFVFb-ylEie7b4GnQ.text: Arrived in London around 11AM and our hotel room wasn't going to be ready until 3. We took a stroll through Hyde Park and came over to the Mayfair Chippy for lunch. We were seated promptly and service throughout the entire meal was quick and pleasant.My husband and I both got the Mayfair special, one of us got cod and one got haddock. We honestly couldn't really tell the difference, both were delicious. Both plates came out piping hot. I loved the tartar sauce and the curry sauce was nice for a change of pace. The fish was perfectly cooked, not greasy, and nice and flaky. It was a bit on the $ side for a lunch but the portions were generous. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

hf4-DnH1ZECkj3rCVgjxpg.text: Excellent fish and chips!    And the free scraps are to die for (literally - don't eat too many of them)

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

v6YOmTAUxs7Qml85Cf3kcQ.text: Visited for the first time on a sunny Sunday afternoon and sat outside, although the inside looked quite inviting!Interesting menu, with many modern choices and alternatives to the more traditional "fish & chips", including veggie and vegan options.We went for the traditional fish and chips: after living away from the UK for 20+ years I always look for good fish and chips when I back there.Food was great, really great chips. Very well presented and very fresh.Service was great.A little expensive for a "chippy" but given the location, not a problem.We will go back there for sure.

115ZQcfolgHbahVIUuqnPw.text: I ordered fish (cod) and chips. The order comes with 3 different types of sauces: curry, tartar, and snow pea. My favorite is curry, which was surprising! The fish was very crispy on the outside and soft in the inside, and I am impressed, especially I took it to go! This is a fish and chip restaurant that requires reservation. The restaurant is small. I did not make a reservation, and was not able to get a table. However, I decided to get it to go! This is a Michelin stars level restaurant! They deserved this recognition. It is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Fish (cod) and chips
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Took it Togo!

exF-Dqce4dULuyLOEGVa4A.text: Worth a visit!  The restaurant is quite small inside, with a long bar area and very cramped dining quarters in the back of the restaurant.  I had the Mayfair Classic which comes with a choice of battered cod or haddock, chips, mushy peas, and two sauces (curry and tatar).  It was surprisingly a decent amount of food, piping hot and not greasy tasting at all!For apps, we also got an order of scotch egg and the pickles.  Scotch egg was fantastic but i'm not sure how you could muck up a sausage fried egg.  The pickles were good to palate cleanse against the fried foods, and I'm glad we had something sour, but there were too many onions to pickled veggies, they should consider adding more variety, especially for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair Classic with Cod, tartar sauce, mush peas, and curry sauce

au6Tm-t6hAcFoOjZ6TjATg.text: A quick aside before my review. This place handled a belligerent guest very well during my recent visit. A guy came in at 9:57 pm when the place closes at 10 pm and got very heated when the staff told him the kitchen had already begun shutting down for the night. He was not happy that he drove all the way there just to be turned away so he started yelling. The staff took him outside to hear his complaints and that didn't kill the mood for the people who were inside wrapping up their dinners. Well done wait staff!The food here was exceptional. My partner and I both went with the mayfair classic (£15.75) which was traditional fish and chips with three great accompanying options. The options were mushy peas, tarter sauce, and curry sauce. They were all very different but very good and helped create a different experience with each bite. The shop is small but there is plenty of counter space and outdoor seating to accommodate most people who want in. And if there is a wait, it is definitely worth it.

gUniFGvd1D5_z45_hPCYtA.text: Small restaurant with limited tables, but very good fish and chips.  Fish is crispy, flaky and moist.  Generous portion.  Sides of mushy peas, tartar and curry are all very good.  Central location and reasonably priced.  A go to spot in Mayfair.

vSe9Xu5HM7gsUcvD_qH5YQ.text: Did you rly go to London if you didn't have fish n chips?!  Loved that they had the vegan fish and chip option since my friend was allergic to fish and I'm vegetarian! The vegan fish didn't stay together but was crispy! Not a big fan of the taste but was worth trying!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

m5JPYIIC9HR9Cdtq71lVdg.text: So wonderful I ended up going twice in a four day trip to London. Wonderful fish and chips. Wonderful interior and a great staff to boot. Hope you get in. It's a bit small but they do turn the tables fast.

4k_rut8nwAD3Szl0WdYmfw.text: First time being in London in four years and immediately wanted to get my obligatory fish n chips meal out of the way. Mayfair Chippy did not disappoint. I've been to some of the more popular fish n chips spots in London such as Poppies and the Golden Hind and Mayfair Chippy was the better than all of them. May very well have been the best fish m chips I've ever had. A classic British dish everyone must have. Well done.

c6UsF0jXZwZdR-EK1A4orQ.text: I heard about this place from several others that it's the best fish and chips in London. So I decided to try it out and see if it was true. I ordered the cod fish and chips and an appetizer called cockles. The cockles are ok but the fish and chips was the best I've ever had. Mayfair chippy offers several dipping sauces to go with the fish but I went with old fashioned vinegar and lemon. If your in London put this place on your list it's awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Amazing lunch
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

BT4qAPLlHabVL1qyW-DRJw.text: oh my gosh, mayfair is such a POSH area. we stopped by this spot for dinner after some shopping at selfridges down the street. started with the salt and pepper calamari, which was average. got the mayfair class and the soft shell crab sandwich as mains - both were good, but quite pricey! i would just do the classic fish n chips here next time - the extras are a bit of a letdown.  service was good, and the place gets busy, surprisingly! takeout could be a great option.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Crab
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair classic with cod

VVvBw04lr2JujO7t7EPBMA.text: When in the UK, it is recommended that we get fish and chips. This place was suggested from several sources and I decided to give it a try. Boy, was this the biggest piece of fish I ever had! Cod is the most common fish to order, but some people order haddock. It was fried perfectly and was extremely delicious. The presentation was perfect as well. It came with 3 sauces - tartar, mushy peas (not really a sauce I guess), and chip shop curry sauce. I still preferred the tartar, but I didn't mind trying the other 2. Don't let the name mushy peas turn you off - it's actually not bad. And to warn you, it's actually a pretty big portion. Pair it with an ice cold coke and you are good to go!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Fried Cod

nDJBCMeWaEm2FYdUDXskag.text: Stopped by after lunch around 3pm before shopping on Oxford.  Had to wait ten minutes for a stool as all tables were full.  Take away (takeout for you silly Americans) moves quickly.  Patrons behind us ordered take away and got their order before we even got inside.  Super friendly staff.  Free wifi. Extensive beverage selection with beer, soft drinks, tea, coffee and various wine varietals on offer.  Waitress was extremely swamped and pleasantly took our order fifteen minutes later.  Food came out in ten minutes.  All the waiting was well worth it.  We ordered the Mayfair Classic.  One with HP gravy & other with chip shop curry sauce.  Both sauces are incredible.  The actual fish is to die for.  We had the cod.  It was so crispy that you actually needed the fork to cut into it.  The hand cut chips (fries...for you know who) were large thick crispy & flakey cuts of potato fried to perfection.  The tartar is amazing as was the mushy peas.  Can't wait for a repeat visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Frontier Lager
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. smaller take away menu while waiting in line

SCxIOrqiWhg9QgUxlR7zIA.text: Staff was friendly. Portions are huge, the fish needed more flavor/seasoning. The place is tiny, but that's pretty much everywhere in London.

lZm4cfNny-qg-zejTM49SQ.text: It's better to book appointment for dinner, otherwise it maybe a long wait. Mussels is recommended. The food overall were good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. The food overall were good! Recommend the mussels! It's better to book appointment for dinner, otherwise it maybe a long wait!

5FGJpkJnmxQKIwNZQsaZEA.text: This was one of the best meals we had in London! This place was a few block from our hotel and we discovered it on our first day in London. We shared a cod fish and chips and a lager. The lager was delicious and went really well with the fish. The cod was huge and enough for the both of us. The tartar sauce was freshly made and really yummy! I wish I lived closer to this place. SO good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. We split the dish and we're stuffed!
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. So good!

pEVk83ygch9wnyKzgn9Xfw.text: Someone from the hotel we are staying at recommended this place as the best fish and chips in England. It was a little difficult to find where this place was despite the signs we found along the way as their is no explicit sign on the top of the restaurant.The decor in here is really cute and modern! The waitresses were also kind and attentive. We ended up settling on the Plaice and Chips and the Cod and Chips.Both fried fish tasted very clean and not fishy. I preferred the cod over the plaice, but both are great options. I did not care for the chips as they were far too dense and not fried well. Our meal came out to around $50 for just two plates which is a lot! However, we were able to share both plates between 4 people with everyone feeling full.I haven't had other fish and chips in England to compare to coming here but I really enjoyed the fish here. You can order the fish without the chips (they charge extra for them) and I recommend you do so as they weren't very good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

go5ik62XfbhApJQ610lOjA.text: The BEST fish and chips I had while visiting England, Scotland, and Ireland. I did my research before my trip to London to see who had legit fish and chips. I was immediately drawn to Mayfair Chippy's presentation, choice of sauces (tartar and curry), serving of mushy peas (what's up with places that serve whole peas?! yuck!), and modern decor. I also noticed that others mentioned to make a reservation, so I also made one via Open Table a week in advance. Upon arriving, there was a couple that stepped in right before us. They did not have a reservation and were turned away, as the space is quite small and they had reservations to fill tables for the rest of the night. They were offered take away, but declined (so if you are like them and are unable to secure a reservation, there is take away available!). We were immediately seated in the back room and placed an order for drinks (beer and rose). We both knew we wanted the Mayfair Special, as it is the one that comes with the fish and chips, mushy peas, tartar sauce, and curry sauce. My husband went with the haddock and I chose the cod. The haddock had a slightly more fishy flavor, but both looked identical as far as presentation. Let me tell you, this was hands down the BEST fish and chips we had while abroad. I also made sure to compare to places that were similar to Mayfair Chippy (slightly modern, gastropubbish, hipster influences, etc., not places that are traditional mom and pop fish and chip spots). The fish was a generous portion and perfectly fried. The lemon gave the fish a nice, fresh, clean taste. The mushy peas were also my favorite out of all of the places we dined at. The curry sauce was a unique twist on the tradition, but definitely a great addition! Overall, I highly recommend The Mayfair Chippy if you want to try amazing fish and chips while in London. They also played a lot of 80s American/British music while we dined...  I had Careless Whisper stuck in my head for the rest of the night, ha.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Dranks

5PY1ffA7ga_IfWW5jFYcRw.text: Excellent fish, fast service, mediocre chips! We got take away which may be the reason the chips were more soggy than crisp but overall it was great!

gqpBabCckob4KKBpQ-IzJQ.text: 2nd best fish and chips in my life! Got their fish to share with my husband. We ventured to Mayfair kind of late, and unfortunately, they were no longer seating people, but they happily took our order for "to-go".I didn't care for sitting down, so I went ahead and ordered the haddock fish. To my surprise, chips do not come with it - this is extra. That itself warrants 1 less star regardless of how tasty their fish was. Now,  when you think of fish and chips, it really should be a combo type thing, but when you make then a separate deal... It just makes it awkward (maybe cause Americans are weird). Regardless, I am over the moon that we made the venture here because I did not regret one bite of it. In fact, I was more bummed at the fact that we didn't order 2 fish! Yes, it was THAT good!If I am to visit London again, I think I might come back to Chippy's first and next time, I promise I will order the fries!

wRi7d-CN_MxPc-KJEyJ21w.text: So apparently I'm going to be like most other reviews down the list and say that The Mayfair Chippy made the best fish & chips I had in London, without a doubt. This statement is not taken lightly, especially due to the fact that, 1) we had excellent fish & chips at a number of other establishments throughout the area, and 2) The Mayfair Chippy wasn't even on our initial radar to check out. We basically passed the place on our way to visit the US Embassy, and decided we were hungry enough to stop in. Glad we did. Order the "Mayfair Classic". Along with your fried fish (cod or haddock), you get three dipping sauces/sides: tartar, mushy peas, and curry. If only fish & chips shops in the US had this same type of offering.Service was friendly and attentive. I'll be seeing The Mayfair Chippy again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. The Mayfair Classic.

ALUoqiFOqVqqnxZd3cPhMA.text: This is the fish and chip place to end all other fish and chip places.  Jesus on a jet ski...I'd take a non-stop flight back to London from Phoenix just to eat here again.Amazing fish and chips, friendly service, decent price; zero complaints.  THIS is the place you want to come.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

xqcqfnfgQkPJLI_WXTd3Mg.text: Amazing fish & chips and great location. Service could use some work.We got the Mayfair Classic with cod. The fish is just perfect - light, well seasoned, and covered in a crunchy and airy batter. The plate comes with tartar sauce (so so good), curry sauce, and mushy peas. You can also order "scraps" for free - they give you the little crunchy batter pieces that come off the fryer, and I would argue they're even better than the fries.We also got a crab, watermelon, and avocado salad as a starter. I was expecting a pretty rustic plate, but it was beautiful and elegant, with little cubes of watermelon, dollops of avocado cream, and two types of crab salad spooned on top.So overall, the food was amazing, but the servers were absent from the second we stepped in. Even though there were only 2 other groups in the restaurant, it took 15 minutes before someone took our order, 30 minutes before our food arrived, and then forever to flag someone down to pay them. Despite all of that, would still recommend if you're looking for some tasty fish & chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair classic, starter salad, scraps

9x4kAMQ6VkDkwqqKlKmafg.text: Terrific place for tourists to enjoy some good-quality and genuine English food. As well as for us Londoners to get a scrumptious chip butty on the lunch hour or the way to the tube.Rather busy as of late, but understandably so.Warmly recommend!

ApoC5oSm1e5Fbg3Z4LSp_g.text: Well-deserved recommendation in the Michelin Guide for The Mayfair Chippy's fish and chips - they do not disappoint!After reading that the inside was fairly small and that it could get busy, I made a reservation in advance via OpenTable, which was perfect; we were seated immediately on arrival at a communal table with the cutest swing-out stools. Their menu covers a variety of traditional British dishes, but they specialize in fish and chips and are known for their "Mayfair Classic" - fried cod or haddock and chips with mushy peas, tartar sauce, and curry sauce. The boyfriend and I couldn't resist both ordering this, and our eyes and stomachs were in for a treat!The presentation of the fish and chips was wonderfully clean, with the sides each in a little copper cup and everything arranged nicely on a wooden block. The taste was up to par with the aesthetics, and each bite of the perfectly battered golden fish was delicious - amazing texture! The accompanying sauces only added to the flavor and the chips and mushy peas were great as well. The portion size was just right to fill you up without feeling too overstuffed.The main reason for deducting a star was the service - while we were seated right away, it took ages for our waiter to come by and acknowledge us, let alone take our orders. He never came by again afterwards and another employee ended up helping us with the check instead. Besides that, we really enjoyed the food here and our fish and chips craving was definitely fulfilled!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Frontier lager 1/2 pint
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair Classic

x4oryZVL83FIFcaCPPca7A.text: We came right at closing time and had to order it for take away. Ordered both haddock and cod. I personally preferred haddock cause it was more flavorful. Curry sauce and tartar sauce were the tastiest and flavorful. The curry sauce went really well with the fries and the tartar sauce with the fish. They also had a mashed peas sauce that was decent and more traditional. The fish was lightly battered, juicy, and a pleasure to eat. We had it for take away since they were closing and the food stayed warm in the boxes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

roxTQlDL20MU-fw-XvZ5TQ.text: First time to London/Europe and immediately looked for a fish and chips spot. Found Mayfair Chippy and it didn't disappoint. Ordered cod fish & chips, mushy peas, black pudding and pint of Guinness! Awesome!!! One tip - MAKE RESERVATIONS. This place gets understandably busy! Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Black pudding is highly recommended.
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Best Fish & Chips ever!

pKR3oLKL5KHod558gtBDaA.text: We were excited to try The Mayfair Chippy. We made a reservation and ended up being seated at the first table inside and open door. We asked to be moved and were moved one table further from the front door across from the cash desk. A family came in to eat and did not have reservations. They ended up waiting with the screaming kids right behind our table. The screaming kids aren't Mayfair Chippy's fault ... just annoying. Once we got settled, the service was good. I enjoyed my shrimp and chips. My friend had a shepherds pie that she thought was dry ... then she added the gravy provided in a small pitcher. The food was really quite good. It arrived quickly and was nice and piping hot.I'd recommend this for a good quality dinner!

oicO3vhoppyjZJ1Mt8l3zQ.text: Fish and Chips in London... The ultimate cliche. Yet, it really is a necessity when visiting this great city. I was lucky enough to have what was likely the best fish and chips I've ever consumed at Mayfair Chippy.This restaurant is small and unassuming. There are a small amount of tables for seating and there is a long table able against the wall with chairs to sit as well. The restaurant itself is very nice and in a great part of the city.I had the fish and chips and a glass of wine. The fish was tender to the core and melting in my mouth with every bite. It was perfectly fried, seasoned and battered which created an amazing taste. The fries were thick cut, perfectly fried and delicious. I had a glass of wine from Argentina and it was the perfect pairing. The service was also excellent as the server suggested the wine we had based on my taste preference. The food was also prepared in a very reasonable amount of time given how delicious and perfectly cooked everything was. I literally couldn't ask for more.Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Delicious fish and chips

d5VoeXlQMDDjGif9bzlN5g.text: Yelp pictures looked amazing for this place so we stopped by! There was 7 of us and we didn't know we needed reservations. We told him we were from out of town and only had one night here. The guy was pretty rude and didn't care, but we somehow worked it out and got seats. The fish and chips were soooooo good! It comes with two sauces (the curry was good but tartare sauce was bomb!!!) and a side of mushy peas. I usually don't like mushy peas but theirs was amazing. My friend got the Sheppard's pie, and it was AMAZING! So glad he got it and we shared our two plates. It was so flavorful and delicious. The food and decor get 5 stars, but their staff should be a little more friendly :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Sheppard's pie
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Rose lemonade! So good!!!
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair classic

H31EepwJfGgYXi1OhcagEQ.text: Ok so fish and chips are a staple here and no London trip is complete without having fish and chips. So there are many places to choose from but we based our decision to come here on the reviews for sticky toffee pudding.The reviews for the fish and chips are great so that made it even more of a reason to come here.We ordered the cod and  chips- you have a choice of haddock or cod. We heard the haddock is Oilier. The fish is huge and comes with a great serving of fries. Also, 3 dipping sauces!! One was tartar sauce, another one was a curry sauce and the last was smashed peas. Absolutely delicious!! For the Americans that love their ketchup you have to ask for it there's none on the table. The fish was outstanding. Luckily we came at a time where there was a table available. We washed as dozens of people get turned away because they were no seating because Of already booked reservations!!! No joke!! Now onto the sticky toffee pudding. It was absolutely disappointing. It came in a cup that look like a Sundae. The toffee tasted burnt, the ice cream was grainy and sugary and the cake was hard. While  the fish and chips were not a disappointment, the desert definitely was. Save your appetite for dessert at any other joint. There was a restaurant next-door that had amazing sticky toffee pudding  because we saw people enjoying it as we were walking by.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

-TxmNufg25fn3l_zd0cY8A.text: This place deserves all the praises Bc they really live up to it! FoodFish and chips: not all fish and chips are created equal... this place's got it right! Not heavy rolled in battered, it was just lightly and crisply done! Steamed muscles: OMG, this has got to be the best steamed muscles I've had. The muscle was so fresh and sweet, I almost drank all of the juice that the muscles were soaked in!! Next time I would order the full size instead of appetizers. Salt and pepper squid: this was the only dish I didn't like, it was way way too salty! After we got the check, we were given a little bag of candies; that was a fun surprise.Highly recommend this place!! If you're in the area, you've gotta stop by!

5w0cnM0_DE0WrnOuDn21rg.text: Earning its Michelin ratings for 2015-2018!!! We started with a scotched egg that was amazing! Soft boiled with a curry sauce that wasn't your typical Indian curry. A lot of cumin and a bit of mustard. They have a pretty broad menu, including oysters, mussels, and salmon patties, but, unless you're local or working in London for a while, I'd suggest the Fish & Chips, Mayfair style. They serve it with a madras curry, mushy peas, and a House tartar in cups! The staff is super nice. Very pleasant and professional. The kitchen isn't speedy, but they put out quality that's worth the wait!Tiny downside: No A/C. Not bad on the 330 days that Brits earn that ivory parlor, but a bit stifling on a 22c day!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. The best scotch eggs I've ever had!

GTB-VUbi1BKeJWF7Am5McA.text: Quaint place. Very small so definitely need reservations which are available on open table. Great cod fish and chips.  (Other option was haddock). Upgraded one of the fries with cheese and truffle salt. Amazing. We also had the heritage tomato salad with fried goat cheese which was delicious as well if you're looking for a vegetarian option or appetizer.  Definitely worth a stop by if you're on the hunt for tasty fish and chips.

RbQMssWlMK_KTiJNk5veOQ.text: The best fish and chips I have ever had. The restaurant is small. I think there are about 10 tables or less. There is one table for four outside. If there is a wait, I would say it's worth it. The fish is lightly battered in beer batter. It has a great taste. Super crunchy on the outside and soft and flakey  fish inside. It was cooked perfectly. The fries were delicious. I ordered the meal with the three sauces to try them out. I wasn't a fan of the curry like sauce or the smashed peas. But the tartar sauce was amazing. I would only get the tartar from now on. We were only in town for a few days and yet we ate here twice because it was that good. The next time I'm on London I will definitely be back.

pRS4jjkT4K7FB3f2LaTedA.text: One of the very best "chip shops" in London! Try the "Mayfair Classic" with fried Haddock preferably. Comes with mushy peas, and curry gravy for your chips. LOVED all the FREE "scraps" you care for. Those crispy morsels are a personal favorite. The international staff was friendly, welcoming and provided exceptional service. This is also probably the safest chip shop in London because the police love it! We took a 360 degree selfie with part of the Diplomatic Protection Unit on patrol in Mayfair. One officer suggested I #hashtag the photo #longarmofthelaw. It was a highlight of our visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. A selfie with a Diplomatic Protection unit.

bDdd75sCGGN6XiTev11siA.text: Fish and chips were alright but service was poor.We made reservations at this restaurant for our first meal in London during our trip. We arrived half an hour late as check-in at our hotel took longer than expected and I apologized to the man helping us that we were very late. He didn't say anything such as 'it's okay' or 'no problem', didn't even smile and just seated us at a table. Note that the restaurant was not busy at all and there were plenty of tables because it was a weekday and past peak lunch hour. Took our orders, still no smile. He didn't check in with us to see how our food was but he did with another table. We had the fish and chips and we left disappointed. The food was alright but not spectacular. I didn't research into the menu earlier and didn't know that you only get the 3 sauces if you order the Mayfair Classic, but it would have been great if my server recommended or explained the menu to me. The only thing I liked was the ginger ale they served. Given the poor service, I will take my business somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Love this ginger ale

xd3TR2Xcoc9a6LHCjOokeA.text: u hot the classic with Cod the fush was fresh and very good the best part of the meal was the gravy.  the chios aka french fries were ok at best.  i feel like anything battered and deep fried should be really good.  the service seemed to be impacted by take out...i came here expecting too much its just fish and chips

S8QvxxIobjI3A8UBIE0loQ.text: Alright when in London, you eat fish n chips, or so I've been told. While I'm not a fan of fish n chips, per se, I know that it's a must try. Utilizing the extremely easy online reservation method, I booked my group a reservation here for a late night meal. We were seated right next to a loud and rather messy group and despite the close quarters, we had an OK time.This place is a bit noisy thanks to all the tiling and hard surfaces (sounds echo off), but it's really clean and surprisingly spacious despite the small space.I just had some difficulty with loud noises as the waiters and waitresses kept dropping dining ware and the noise would echo off all of the tiles, which is just loud in such a narrow space.Everyone in my group ordered the fish n chips while I ordered the scotch eggs, because I wanted to try a different UK dish.The food took a bit of time to come in, but we ordered a bucket of muscles that the boys really enjoyed. It was alright although really buttery.The presentation for my scotch eggs was just wonderful and made it extremely fun to eat. I can't say this is a dish for me, but I can see it might suit a carnivore that prefers things a little on the bland salty side. It was only OK in my book and not something I wanted to try again. I did eat some of my boyfriend's fish n chips and oh my gosh, that was well worth trying. The tartar sauce made it all the better by adding all the flavors from the pickles in it. The fish was really crispy as well. In all my travels, this has to be my best fish n chip experience to date! And like I said, I don't even like fish n chips.I recommend coming here for the fish n chips, but don't bother with the other things. I've heard some other foods are not good and considering my experience, I would only come for what they are known for. Don't forget to make a reservation because this place is busy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Scotch Egg

qImbpniMQYrhqNTWUM7FhQ.text: From the name, you could be mistaken for thinking that you were arriving at a takeaway when going to The Mayfair Chippy. But don't be alarmed, this is quality food well-cooked by expert chefs. Fish is very much at the heart of this restaurant, but alongside it comes excellent service that makes you feel both valued and at home. Great!To start our lunch, my friend and I went for the crisp salmon crackling with dill & mustard, six Carlingford rock oysters, steamed mussels served with sourdough bread and the Dexter salt beef fritters with creamed horseradish & pickles. We shared everything so could get a taste of all that was on our table. The food was cooked to perfection and compliments to the chef!There was only ever going to be one main course in a place like this. As you look around the restaurant and see those little design flourishes that make it feel like a high-end chip shop ramped up to the maximum, the fried cod, chips, mushy peas, tartar & chip shop curry sauce becomes the only possible choice for a main. And so it was. This was excellent, a real treat against some of the lesser fish and chip offers on the market.Unlike your local chippy, there was a good selection of desert and we went for the warm chocolate pudding, salted caramel Ice cream & cinder toffee and grabbed a spoon each. The food was as good as the attentive service and we both left filled and happy for the rest of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

Cb4R1U3OSodnEoR3frqJjQ.text: I was there about a year ago. I went there with my friend and didn't know what was the name of this restaurant. We had fish and chips and mussels. Omg it reminded me I was in Brussels. It was so good. Their fish and chips are also amazing. I'm planning to go bk there this weekend. I can't wait. I'm coming from all the way from California!!  This place must make a reservation before you arrive. The place is very small and busy.

PFFOwM2Ho_P0l-MTAriHYg.text: You can't go wrong with any of the starters. The waitress was nice to explain them to us and tel us which were the best ones to try.  And she wasn't wrong.  The salt and pepper squid was my favorite we had to go back the next day to eat it again.  Was crunchy,  full of flavor, and had a great dipping sauce that complimented it very well.  The mussels had a great buttery wine sauce infused with garlic.  You definitely jyst want to drink the sauce.  The mussels are cooked perfectly the single plate is a huge portion.  The Scottish egg was cooked perfectly the yolk was still runny and the gravy was delightful.  The haddock fish cakes was a good portion, for my first time trying haddock this was a good way to try it.  It was not fishy, had a nice crust and the filing was a good compliment. The tomato salad was a light refreshing starter that was my favorite.  The pesto and pine nuts complimented the fresh earthy tomatoes it was a nice crunch and herb flavor.  The servers were great they all helped each other and they all contributed with making our dinner memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Apple Rhubarb tart with custard
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Haddock cake was a nice way to try it for my first time
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Scottish egg

iEks04dQ7xKX1hvzc7OC5g.text: It was quite dead at lunchtime so the vibe was a bit quiet. The fish was delicious. Flavoursome and very crispy batter. Light flakey cod. The tartare sauce was great. The chips were average. A bit stodgy and soft.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Battered cod and chips with a side of mushy peas.

IWBmiF-Ophg-nXECdBnNPw.text: Went with my 5 year old son to get an early dinner and LOVED this. I figured I'd get the haddock and chips and get him a small portion of the cod and chips so we could each sample the other. Only problem was, he demolished his fish before I could get a taste. My little guy lives on chips... So having him finish all his fish and leave some chips on his plate is really high praise for the food. And hey, I wasn't in the mood to share my haddock so maybe we're even. Now, is it perfect? No. Service was acceptable but not warm and fuzzy. Prices are a bit high at £12.75 for fish and chips with peas or pickle extra. They gave me a very long look when I said I didn't have reservations. There's a mandatory 12.5% gratuity. And it's a small place for eat in. But would I rather you eat fish and chips here than the random British pub across the street? Absolutely, and that's what pulls it up to 5 stars for me. Maybe just try to appease them with a reservation, if you can. :-)

jpXmrL7mb6Cz2N6ZHoehUw.text: Really good fish and chips. Steamed mussels tasted amazing too. Loved the environment

61x3qrD3bF36RRu6kAQDiQ.text: Fish was fresh and chips were good but maybe should have drained the fish a bit more before serving it in the tray.  Understanding it is deep fried bit my tray was already pretty soaked with a layer of grease when it was brought to me.

beYxjG5fIZZbAMHDKhfbiQ.text: The BEST fish and chips I have ever had in my life. The fish itself was enormous and the chips were phenomenal. The food was prepared spectacularly. The fish has a great crispy coating and moist fish, while the chips were crispy and not greasy. I wish the owners would open one of these in the States. Just amazing. This was a few miles away from our hotel, and I wish I had found it before our last night! The decor is very eclectic and cute, we got a table all the way in the back and had such a great night. I recommend to everyone to try if you want some serious great fish and chips, and the price for the amount of food was not bad at all!!

2N8jusAMaoIGQFMLqhEDww.text: Tremendously overpriced compared to most other chippies.  Got the Mayfair Classic for 15.50£ + 12.5%  mandatory service charge, for poor service facing the wall on a bar stool.  Fish and fries were BOTH soggy.  Would never come back.  SKIP this one!!!!

T63qn_PskZTgPWNKft7y6Q.text: Trendy fish and chips shop, friendly staffs, plays chilling lounge music. By far the most enjoyable fish n chips. Ordered Plaice fish and chips with delicious lager beer. the chips are very different, not oily. Tartare sauce is amazing with chunky ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Plaice fish and chips with lager beer

lEYBtX_b3b8EboWLaqA9mw.text: The Mayfair Classic & Mussels w/Indian Spices were both very good. Service was great.

I1OdWuvEvls3RYdnwzfBog.text: I would've given this 5 stars if the service was better. The waitress was plain miserable and unhelpful. However the maitre'd was lovely and moved us once a better table became available, we didn't have a reservation either on a busy friday lunchtime. The fish was lovely, a decent sized portion and cooked perfectly. Batter wasn't too heavy but wasn't too light i.e tempura etc. The chips were excellent, crispy and fluffy. All the trimmings good too. We didn't have any alcohol so can't mention the wine list or prices on that front. But £12 for fish and chips, which yes compared to most take-away's is pricey, seemed pretty reasonable considering the location. Also the decor and atmosphere inside is most pleasant.Really enjoyed.

UFzepryWUScigYUDDJbALQ.text: Want a well balanced meal?- Fish- Chips- CurryAll food groups deliciously covered.

bZiLrjtgnSNZiYbtG_a_Yw.text: I stumbled in here looking for a quick bite before an evening appointment. I had, the night prior, been to The Golden Hind, which was rumored to be the best fish and chips in London. I was a little disappointed, but still had the craving, so ordered the same here. I was simply blown away. The fish was clean, flaky, and not overcooked--a rare find. The chips were slightly battered, and thus were crispy on the outside, but dense and soft on the inside. It was a perfect pairing, lightly dusted with salt flakes. I paired with the black pudding fritters, and was delighted. Really an outstanding meal, an unassuming location, and a lovely vibe.

KgjV4eNs2XAbWHjWZMkARw.text: I ordered the crispy cornish squid starter, which was gooood! My wife ordered the classic Mayfair classic with the tartar, pea, & curry sauce. I sampled the curry sauce from my wife's plate & that was the bomb! That curry sauce had this sweet curry flavor to it! Me & wife just walked in this spot without expecting it to be this good! I highly recommend this spot!

EtI4FMiq53T18Nzs1ZZ1VQ.text: The food is Fabulous! However, the wait staff are extremely inattentive! We ate there twice in the week that we have been here. Like I said the food is great yet we won't be back. The waitress was not friendly and a bit aloof, very soft spoken and we couldn't even hear her. Not friendly in both instances. When we had take away, I had to repeat my order 3 times with it being 4 orders of cod fish and chips, 2 salads and 2 loaves of bread. Then when we came to pick up the take away she didn't want to give us butter for the bread stating it will melt by the time we get back to the hotel. The butter 12 hours later is still solid, Not refrigerated. We had to pay extra for tarter sauce, while when we ate in it was included. Our largest complaint was there was a HUGE lack of communication. Food is great, but most  importantly it is the service that also keeps you coming back. Fix the service!!

z_MCya90Ov2dpS3sla7Jcg.text: Great use of space, delicious batter and the chips were perfect. Enjoyed my haddock with a side of the house pickles and a pint of lager. Everything was well executed and the staff were friendly and efficient, although they only seemed to ask me how things were going when my mouth was full

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Haddock with chips

H6uouJLKcY3pSDLTIJ-yzA.text: We never made it here, but they were super nice about holding the doors, but a mishap postponed our arrival. Definitely will go next time, but never thought of it as a steakhouse (or did I read that wrong?)--never order steak at a chipper! Think about it--fish flavoured steak? Can't wait to try!

GvR8h6aduXjSkZQ2jNKQng.text: thanks fellow yelpers for  directing me to this place...totally awesome fish & chips!Light, delicate cod (you can choose haddock, too) beautifully coated in a crispy batter that definitely was NOT fried in old oil so the fish shined elegantly with the acidity of the malt vinegar (or with the light creamy tartar sauce that did not overpower)I'm now in a post meal coma, chillin' after another exhausting tourist trek through London...mahalo to all the yelpsters in the UK!

7s1H058uLwkkzVVpQPSS0Q.text: Service was slow, fish and chips were good. Loved the curry sauce. Not sure the peas are my thing. Was it coincidence that the Americans were all seated in the back?

IBSPk9RBoRYYqXmkBMWyPQ.text: The fish here is amazing! It is so fresh and light. I wasn't crazy about the chips. Not that there was anything wrong with them, but I like my fries thin and crispy and these were thick steak fries. Even so, I definitely recommend coming here for the fish and chips! So much better than you can get in any of the pubs around the area.

NtRmNd0e8sf86Xubwflr4Q.text: Great spot in A wonderful neighborhood. My wife and I had the Cod fish and chips and they where as expected, wonderful. It's a tiny little place that new and trendy that offered traditional English fish and chips with great service.

UjKrPv70t-qPyn-Mpa1vrg.text: Great fish and chips. I would recommend a reservation. The fish and chips were beer battered and not at all greasy. I am not a big fan of deep fried foods, but this meal was perfect. We sat a a community type  table with stools, hence the recommendation for reservation. This is not a fancy place, but clean and friendly.

_gDhZo0ydBjRZa6ZeYns6w.text: Best fish & chips I ever had, and vessels are amazing, don't forget to ask more bread to eat with soup from bottom of vessel pot, you'll love it a lot! And waitresses are nice. Wonderful meal!

fH5rVcF29pwkm89lvLLCEA.text: Really want to give 5 stars but service counts! First off the food is WONDERFUL! The fish is fried to perfection and the batter is utterly delicious. Chips are the perfect size with the right amount of crisp. The portions for £14 is excellent. The oysters are remarkably fresh.The decor is clean and modern without being over the top. Now on to the service.....unfortunately I cannot rave about this part of our experience. After clearing our meal and we let the server know we would need to heading out as we were dealing with an upset little one (which she had observed who was waiting out so as to not disturb the other patrons). The server cleared another table and checked them out and went to the front of restaurant to chat with a colleague. After attempting to gather her attention again she rather briskly checked us out.  By this point there were no other patrons in the restaurant as we sat and waited to pay. I wish this didn't happen would have been a 5 plus star experience .

S-6pb16fM_2tR6N2LY32ZA.text: Came here to eat on a friday, service was friendly but rather slow, especially since the room was effectively private, (no-one else). Food was great, bit more expensive than the average fish and chip shop but not exactly a surprise in Mayfair!

WrMC0SHUjDyIkEYl0NylOg.text: This was quite a nice fish and chips place.  Service was quick and attentive.  The portions were adequate....just adequate.  Perhaps they should offer a larger option.  A good experience overall.

19_ClYAhjqHGfmEyKvnciA.text: Amazing fish and chips, mushy peas, mussels and crab toast. Wonderful service!  We will definitely come back!

J2NhWQvHvNTvD1UMSvY8hA.text: Delicious fish and chips, the highlight was the mushy peas topped with ham hawk, nice and quiet ambiance as well made for a great evening meal,

CF_Je07fw6mpzO73N4YV6A.text: Great place to have authentic British Experience to have fish and chips in London . Drafted beer and great sea food . Highly recommend the oysters.

CnzCgp3EueZcpwG_aMfltw.text: I was surprised at how amazing the fish and chips were. I saw the amazing reviews and knew I had to get it. It's definitely affordable if you take away and go eat at a park somewhere. Dining in looked nice too, but we wanted a nice cheap meal for our last day in London. Quality is amazing and they made our order very fast. Definitely check them out.

FXedpy5A-cr_v8ExpStIWw.text: Fish and chips was amazing. Went with the haddock version. Delicious curry sauce served with fish. Fries were excellent too! My daughter had the steak, because she doesn't like fish. It wasn't good at all. Presented well, but despite herb butter on top, it lacked flavor and texture was tough. Could have put steak sauce on it if they had some. She wanted the Shepard's pie-- but they were out. Waitress seemed indifferent to us, but pleasant. It was 77 pounds, for 2 fish and chips deluxe, 1 steak, 1 glass of wine and they charged 2.5 pounds for tap water.

aw7mDSL7GC_vURPDmc1UvQ.text: YUUMMMMYYYY! We were lucky to squeeze in for lunch without a reservation because after we were seated, others were turned away if they didn't reserve first, so beware. We got the fish and chip special, one with haddock and one with cod, but we couldn't taste a difference. We had an appetizer of the fried squid. That was delicious with a very crispy coating! The fish was great, crisp and light! The chips, served underneath the fish, were perfect and plentiful! Loved the tartar sauce, passed on the curry sauce, the mushy peas were ok. Prices were decent. Service was attentive. The space was cute and cozy.

ehlesZS3vl1MeDJlUzzwMg.text: A good place for fish and chips. A little "hole in the wall" place that was a little difficult to find, but now we know where it is. I was happy with the service and the Bulgarian waitress was busy but friendly. Had a delicious pot of mussels with a white wine sauce that I finished as a soup.

ptzQv25mIk_aBOfeqJ90ew.text: Mayfair classic is a must try here. It has the sauces that are fun to try. It wasn't easy to get in with a party of five, so we split the group. The fish was good not greasy. The cod was not fishy to taste but it wasn't flavorful either, as cod don't typically have a strong taste.

slNFrSeC5WHQ6Hl48XhXZA.text: The cod fish and chips were exactly what I needed after a long day of exploring. My wife got the shepherd's pie which was also incredibly delicious. The restaurant had a great vibe tucked away on the street. The staff were very kind and helpful. Every visitor of London should add this to their list. Thanks for the great food and experience!

zsa6h28p5fee4gqRQzh1cg.text: Yummy. We ordered their famous fish and chips as well as crab toast, tomato salad and chocolate pudding. My favorite was actually the crab toast - sooo good. Crisp toast, perfectly seasoned crab salad and avocado. Service was good as well.

oWcPBTkhe6TZqZjtM07-Gw.text: OK. Fish. Chips are not that great.Starters are very good especially mussels & oysters.Excellently situated in Mayfair.Very slow service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom

uWHXnfqFrab0ACKjq3O6rg.text: We visited the Mayfair Chippy on a Sunday night for dinner. We did not make a reservation and showed up around 8:00pm, the place was full. We had to wait about an hour until we were seated, but it was well worth it. The fish and chips were the best we had while in London.

ktvhy5DFDEgALjOLlZCYnQ.text: In town on business. Had F&C in the UK several times over the years. Sometimes you get em with bones and skin on. That makes me want to gag just thinking about it. Was going to try a more traditional spot but this one looked appealing. Here's the breakdown:- small space but it wasn't crowded when I got there at seven. - beetroot salad. I normally find beets to be disgusting, something of a last resort vegetable. But this salad was great. Can't describe the flavor but with goat cheese and candied walnuts it had just the right texture.   See pic. - cod was moist enough, batter was OK. Had better back home but it was solid. - chips were very good, thick cut- home made tartar sauce also good- mushy peas were blandBottom line: worth a try

photos.caption: Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Beetroot salad
Photo of The Mayfair Chippy - London, United Kingdom. Cod & Chips

Q9eSCs5oFPhH6AYrK7weAw.text: If this is one of the best fish and chips in London then I truly feel sorry for you folks in the UK. Terrible service meets mediocre food..... and to boot they double charged my credit card. Do not waste your time  to eat at this dump - many options within walking distance where you can get ripped off. Watch for their tip trolling behavior where they added 20% tip for themselves for our small table with 4 guests (myself, wife, 14 yr old daughter and her friend). Freaking 20% for the worst service possible. 2 fish and chips - 1 scampi and 1 mussel = 98 pounds including the huge tip they gave to themselves using my card - twice. Get new staff or get outta business. To the staff we were unfortunately subject to - tips are meant as a gesture from your patrons (you know, the people where your money comes from) to determine the level of service above and beyond the price of the meal itself. You knew how crappy the service was in general thus ensured your own huge tip although truly you deserved to be fired. Shameful........

rQCXRPpPEA2dCLQhmKHXNQ.text: The fish and chips here were solid but we weren't overly impressed with the rest of the dishes.
